intro: Pauridia breviscapa, commonly known as the short-stemmed pauridia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in woodland areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Pauridia breviscapa is often found in temperate regions of Asia and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
